summary: An email from a Victim Program Manager requesting discovery information from a recipient who worked with a victim in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. The email seeks contact details for victims, witnesses, or their attorneys to be provided to the USAO for the upcoming trial scheduled for November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the New York investigation alongside Ghislaine Maxwell, with a trial scheduled for November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a subject of the New York investigation alongside Jeffrey Epstein, with a trial scheduled for November 29, 2021.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects of the same New York investigation (50D-NY-3027571) and are scheduled for trial together.

events.title: Epstein/Maxwell Trial Date
events.description: The New York investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled for trial.

events.title: Discovery Information Deadline
events.description: Deadline for the recipient to provide requested victim/witness/attorney contact information for discovery purposes to the USAO.

keyFacts: The New York investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell (case 50D-NY-3027571) was scheduled for trial on November 29, 2021.
The USAO was collecting all communications (texts, emails, voicemails) with any victim, witness, or victim's attorney for criminal discovery purposes.
The document is a discovery request sent on September 10, 2021, with a tight deadline of COB September 13, 2021, for providing victim/witness/attorney contact information.
The sender is a Program Manager from the Victim Program Management Unit, indicating organized victim support and coordination within the investigation.
The request seeks to identify any additional victim service providers (VSs) who may have assisted victims in the case but were not initially included in the communication.
